title: 115_hr2835
content: There is no relevant information provided in the prev_chunk to summarize the curr_chunk. Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act is amended to include a guarantee fee waiver for veterans, defining the term 'veteran or spouse of a veteran' and specifying that the Administrator may not collect a guarantee fee for certain loans. The Small Business Act is amended to waive guarantee fees for veterans or spouses of veterans on loans up to $150,000 made after a specified date, with an exception if the President's budget includes related costs. The Small Business Act is amended to waive guarantee fees for veterans or spouses of veterans on loans up to $150,000 made after a specified date, with an exception if the President's budget includes related costs. Additionally, a definition for "veteran or spouse of a veteran" is provided, and a guarantee fee waiver is established for them. The Administrator cannot collect a guarantee fee for loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or spouses of veterans after a specified date, unless the President's budget includes related costs. Title 31, United States Code, states that loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or spouses of veterans are exempt from guarantee fees, unless the program cost exceeds zero. Loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or spouses of veterans are exempt from guarantee fees, unless the program cost exceeds zero.
